text: Lawrenceville School is a boarding prep school in the U.S. state of New Jersey. It was started in 1810 by Isaac Van Arsdale Brown, as the Maidenhead Academy. Until 1987 it did not let girls be students. Tuition for boarding students coses $53,320 plus a medical fee of $755, a technology fee of $465, and tuition refund insurance costing $453. ==References== Category:Schools in New Jersey Category:1810 establishments in the United States Category:19th- century establishments in New Jersey
title: Lawrenceville School
